author: cole.vt
title: MissionDrivenPools Media Competiton
description: ADA holders get info overload choosing from 1000s of SPOs, using dry data + information sources. Should be easy to connect with MDPs.

f6_assessments.q0: I think this proposal idea addresses an important aspect of the challenge, that the visibility of the MDPs is lacking!  And, this idea would bring an important story-telling vehicle to showcase what the community has and could come up with to address the concerns of decentralization and goals of mission driven pools. I'd love to see it happen!
f6_assessments.q1: I agree that the team seems highly likely to successfully implement the plan.  I am a little doubtful of the proposed budget.  Can you really do 11 3-5min. films for $300/film? With translations and subtitles included?!  And the production schedule is quick too (I'd plan to go into June).  However, if so, and if it works, then you all go!  Good luck.
f6_assessments.q2: The Roadmap, although a bit 'fast' as mentioned above, is clear. The KPIs listed for the film reception, are reasonable and sufficient for auditing progress. I'd like to know a little bit more about how the second one, 'How many people were inspired by the videos to delegate with the mission driven stake pool', would be measured. And, I would like to see something about the competition and KPIs to measure success there. The structure is well described, but the 'what success looks like' and how to measure it, is not there (getting greater/lesser participation in the voting, etc. ). I feel that would be important as well.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to establish a motivational framework for social engagement in impact work fueled by the Cardano SPO community. It is poised to catalyze beneficial action by inspiring innovators to do "the right thing" and is perfectly aligned with the I/O PR and media mission as well as with the SDGs, as a mechanism to give visibility and praise to "for good" projects which can reshape the current perilous trajectory of the world.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are very experienced drivers of such change which is reflected in the proposed plan of action. The budget requested is extremely frugal, which illustrates the team's high motivation in seeing this important work through.
f6_assessments.q2: The videos and activities proposed will be promoted via social media, as such perfectly auditable. I cannot underline more the crucial importance of such work not only for the Catalyst and Cardano ecosystem - but for resetting the value system for our world at large which currently suffers from an "ethics amnesia" that can greatly affect the future of humanity.

f6_assessments.q0: It is a good idea that the aim of this project is to help stakers have more kinds of resources than just "dry" information. Yet, that purpose does not seem strong enough to meet the challenge's objectives, meaning that it doesn't add much value to the Cardano ecosystem. Can the SPOs gain their delegators in the process of the competition itself? Is there a risk that creates a gap between SPOs which are needy for public attention and the ones that already have that (because of the voting method)? Therefore, I give it a 3 on the criteria of impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project sounds quite easy to be carried out, but to do it 
 effectively is my biggest question. To go more specifically on voting, the voting platform has not been clearly stated in the proposal, and whether every holder's vote matter equally or the weight of the vote depends on the amount of ADA that they are holding. It seems like a cycle to me that SPOs need advertising videos to gain delegators' trust, meanwhile they need to to earn community's trust first in order to win the voting and get a video made, so the proposers should probably consider that as well. And having seen the previous works that the team has done, we need to work more on the quality (more dynamic, smoother, etc.) so that it is strong enough to draw the attention of holders.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs concept for the videos is there, and that's a great thing. However, KPIs for the project itself is also needed, for example, the number of SPOs participating in the competition, satisfaction level of compertitors/winners,..
